issue.title: Allow node communication outside the LAN

content.raw: @carlosf_m , right now you should be able to communicate nodes running on different machines. This happens automatically and you shouldn't have to do anything special (the magic of auto-discovery). For example, you can try the `publisher`, `subscriber` examples running each executable on a different machine. Issue #9 captures the idea of running the publisher and subscriber with Internet in-between, as oppose to running them on the same LAN as I suggested.
